headline: Fed Aims to Let Big Banks Take More Risks
abstract: Proposed tweaks to the Volcker Rule, which curbs bank risk-taking, would allow firms to invest heavily in funds backing start-ups.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON â€” Banks could invest heavily in or even sponsor venture capital funds under a proposed change to a post-crisis rule that was intended to limit their risk-taking.
keywords: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
